channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [FLINK-3842] Fix handling null record/row in generated code
item.description:
Handling null record/rows is needed to implement features like outer joins.
Right know an exception is thrown:

org.apache.flink.runtime.client.JobExecutionException: Job execution failed.

	at org.apache.flink.runtime.jobmanager.JobManager$$anonfun$handleMessage$1$$anonfun$applyOrElse$7.apply$mcV$sp(JobManager.scala:807)

	at scala.concurrent.impl.Future$PromiseCompletingRunnable.run(Future.scala:24)

item.summary: Fix handling null record/row in generated code

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: I couldn't spot the problem for the exception yet. Could you set a break point at FlatJoinRunner:48 and paste the content of the code variable here?

Sure. Bear in mind though the DataSetJoin in the master branch works properly as it does not support outer joins. If you want to reproduce the problem you could use my branch: https://github.com/dawidwys/flink/tree/outerJoin

code} variable from {{FlatJoinRunner:48:

      public class DataSetJoinRule$54
          implements org.apache.flink.api.common.functions.FlatJoinFunction {

        
        transient org.apache.flink.api.table.Row out =
            new org.apache.flink.api.table.Row(6);
        
        

        public DataSetJoinRule$54() throws Exception{
          
          
        }

        @Override
        public void join(Object _in1, Object _in2, org.apache.flink.util.Collector c) throws Exception {
          org.apache.flink.api.table.Row in1 = (org.apache.flink.api.table.Row) _in1;
          org.apache.flink.api.table.Row in2 = (org.apache.flink.api.table.Row) _in2;
          
          long result$52 = (java.lang.Long) in2.productElement(2);
          
          
          java.lang.String result$43 = (java.lang.String) in1.productElement(2);
          
          
          int result$37 = (java.lang.Integer) in1.productElement(0);
          
          
          java.lang.String result$49 = (java.lang.String) in2.productElement(1);
          
          
          int result$46 = (java.lang.Integer) in2.productElement(0);
          
          
          long result$40 = (java.lang.Long) in1.productElement(1);
          
          
          
          
          
          out.setField(0, result$37);
          
          
          
          out.setField(1, result$40);
          
          
          
          out.setField(2, result$43);
          
          
          
          out.setField(3, result$46);
          
          
          
          out.setField(4, result$49);
          
          
          
          out.setField(5, result$52);
          
          c.collect(out);
          
        }
      }

I have implemented a fix for your issue. You can find it here:
https://github.com/twalthr/flink/tree/TableApiInputNullable

I tested it locally. Can you also test if it solves your problem?

It is important that the code generator is initiated with nullableInputs set to true in case of outer joins. Additionally, the nullCheck must be enabled in your test cases.

If it solves your problem, I will open a PR for it.
Thanks a lot. I will gladly test it. Unfortunately I will be able to do this on 4th of May as I will have no access to any PC until then.
I checked your changes with my changes and it does solve the problem, so would be nice if you could open a PR. Thanks twalthr!
Thanks for testing. I will rebase it and open a PR.

GitHub user twalthr opened a pull request:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1974

FLINK-3842 [table] Fix handling null record/row in generated code

Thanks for contributing to Apache Flink. Before you open your pull request, please take the following check list into consideration.
If your changes take all of the items into account, feel free to open your pull request. For more information and/or questions please refer to the [How To Contribute guide](http://flink.apache.org/how-to-contribute.html).
In addition to going through the list, please provide a meaningful description of your changes.

  • [x] General
  • The pull request references the related JIRA issue ("[FLINK-XXX] Jira title text")
  • The pull request addresses only one issue
  • Each commit in the PR has a meaningful commit message (including the JIRA id)
  • [x] Documentation
  • Documentation has been added for new functionality
  • Old documentation affected by the pull request has been updated
  • JavaDoc for public methods has been added
  • [ ] Tests & Build
  • Functionality added by the pull request is covered by tests
  • `mvn clean verify` has been executed successfully locally or a Travis build has passed

This PR adds support for nullable rows. It will be tested by FLINK-2971. Manual tests passed.

You can merge this pull request into a Git repository by running:

$ git pull https://github.com/twalthr/flink TableApiInputNullable

Alternatively you can review and apply these changes as the patch at:

https://github.com/apache/flink/pull/1974.patch

To close this pull request, make a commit to your master/trunk branch
with (at least) the following in the commit message:

This closes #1974
